snippet: Mr. Dumpson, as New York City’s commissioner of welfare in the 1960s, fiercely defended relief payments to the poor as both necessary and moral.
abstract: James R Dumpson, who fiercely defended relief payments as New York City’s commissioner of welfare in the 1960s, dies at age 103.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Dumpson, as New York City’s commissioner of welfare in the 1960s, fiercely defended relief payments to the poor as both necessary and moral.

headline.seo: James R. Dumpson, a Defender of the Poor, Dies at 103
headline.main: James R. Dumpson, a Defender of the Poor, Dies at 103
headline.print_headline: James R. Dumpson, a Defender of the Poor, Dies at 103
